ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a whole lot more about German culture, language, and about various cities in the German speaking world in general
I improved my ability to speak naturally in German and expanded my vocabulary and my grammatical knowledge.
This was my first German course ever, as I only knew how to talk German but not how to write, and it was everything I could have asked for.
This course helped to solidify my confidence in written and conversational German, especially with adjective endings and usage of the genitive case.
This course helped to solidify my confidence in written and conversational German, especially with adjective endings and usage of the genitive case.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The study of multiple different cities in the German speaking world made this course thoroughly enjoyable, and really brought the cultural aspects to light.

I feel like there is a lot of "busy work" homework outside of class, and I feel like I would have had more time to personally study the things I actually needed if I had not had to do the Quia and the Journal and the Journal comments etc. I am not sure if these really helped improve my German.
The structure of the course and the teacher (Thorsten Wilhelm) were perfect to engage me in course. I was always happy to get up and go to class in the morning.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: For sure. Anyone who is interested in German should take this if they hope to become much more fluent
If you want to get better at German, definitely take the class. I think Yale has great language courses, and my German is really good considering I started learning it two years ago!
Definitely, this was my favourite course of the semester. Very engaging and even fun with a small class size.

Yes. Thorsten is amazing; a super easy person to learn from, accessible in and outside of class for endless questions, and capable of conducting a class that was lovely to start my day with every day. The material was well-distributed over the semester and it was fun to learn about different German cities and the arts. The final project and two short papers are quite easy and the workload each week was doable but not busy work in that it wasnt helpful. The grammar throughout the course is palatable as well.
